td.content: s:patient presents with Blood for 3 weeks. she has a history of Lymphedema for past 4 years. patient is a 58 yr old female. she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life ocas ETOH on w/e o:Height 67 in, Weight 129 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 16, MRI arm showed lymphoedema of the arm, mass measuring 13 mm in depth along the volar aspect of the forearm a:Lymphedema p:administered Doxorubicin - 60 mg/m3 IV single dose, repeat q 21d, performed MRI arm, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:a 58 YO white female crystallographer presents with increased Blood over 10 months. o:Height 66 in, Weight 126 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 15, Chest X-Ray showed bilateral pleural thickening more marked on the left side, CT Chest revealed thickening of the skin overlying the mass and non specific ground glass appearance in the upper lung fields B/L, Biopsy of mass confirmed the diagnosis of lymphangiosarcoma a:Lymphedema p:administered Doxorubicin - 60 mg/m3 IV single dose, repeat q 21d, performed Chest X-Ray, CT Chest, Biopsy of mass, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
